body:
Not all of these are re-used between tests (for example, the shape ones are needed only for the `create` tests).

I'd suggest doing away with class variables and instead defining these within the test methods. That may come at the cost of some duplication, but the resulting tests are more readable if they are self contained.
body_html:
Not all of these are re-used between tests (for example, the shape ones are needed only for the create tests).

I'd suggest doing away with class variables and instead defining these within the test methods. That may come at the cost of some duplication, but the resulting tests are more readable if they are self contained.
body_text:
Not all of these are re-used between tests (for example, the shape ones are needed only for the create tests).
I'd suggest doing away with class variables and instead defining these within the test methods. That may come at the cost of some duplication, but the resulting tests are more readable if they are self contained.
